Description: Postcard; printed; reproduction of an old sepia photograph taken in Port Said in 1910 showing a heavily staged scene of two Arab ladies reclining on a couch with a water-pipe in the foreground and a heavily veiled servant standing behind with a tambourine.
Curator's comments: Postally used; the card is dated March 2014 and was sent by a group of British Museum curators attending a course in Leiden, and reads: "Dear St John, As you can see, the three of us are having lots of fun at the Textile Research Centre in Leiden. My tambourine skills have really improved. Bestr wishes, Fahmida, Zeina, Alexandra".
Associated places: Associated with: Leiden, Textile Research Centre
